content:
• Wednesday, October 12, 2011
  • UFPI

    Universal Forest Products (NASDAQ:UFPI) drops 8.3% AH after reporting Q3 revenue of $468.9M (-2%...

    Universal Forest Products (NASDAQ:UFPI) drops 8.3% AH after reporting Q3 revenue of $468.9M (-2% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.29, missing consensus by $4.9M and $0.08. The company blames the shortfall on weakness in the residential construction and retail building markets, and is suspending guidance for the "foreseeable future."

     
     
     
     
    | 5:27 PM
  • SHLDQ

    Bloomberg reports Sears (SHLD) is evaluating all avenues for its brands, suggesting it may...

    Bloomberg reports Sears (SHLD) is evaluating all avenues for its brands, suggesting it may license and receive fees for Kenmore, Craftsman, and Diehard. Shares +5.5% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:58 PM | 2 Comments
  • AKAM

    Akamai (NASDAQ:AKAM) soars 12.1% AH after BI claims multiple sources believe Google...

    Akamai (NASDAQ:AKAM) soars 12.1% AH after BI claims multiple sources believe Google (NASDAQ:GOOG) is about to acquire the company. BI thinks an acquisition could be a smart move given Akamai's valuation, and its "trove of valuable data" on web users. One could also add the ability of Akamai's massive network to improve the performance of Google services. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM
  • CUR

    Microcap biotech firm Neuralstem (CUR +7.8%) finishes the day with a solid gain after it saying...

    Microcap biotech firm Neuralstem (CUR +7.8%) finishes the day with a solid gain after it saying it received a notice of allowance from the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office for an application pertaining its method for delivering a therapeutic agent to a spinal cord target.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM
  • GTE

    Gran Tierra Energy (GTE +8.7%) jumps after saying it's initiated exploratory drilling operations...

    Gran Tierra Energy (GTE +8.7%) jumps after saying it's initiated exploratory drilling operations on two oil prospects in Brazil and another in Colombia.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM -2.1%) sells off as outages plague its data services for the third...

    Research In Motion (RIMM -2.1%) sells off as outages plague its data services for the third straight day, reaching North America and sending Wall Street into withdrawal. As Susquehanna notes, the real problem for RIM isn't any short-term revenue loss, but the building of "negative goodwill," and the potential for even greater customer defections.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM
  • HST

    Host Hotels & Resorts (HST +5.2%) pops after its Q3 beats expectations, posting narrower...

    Host Hotels & Resorts (HST +5.2%) pops after its Q3 beats expectations, posting narrower losses as newly acquired properties helped boost revenue. Despite a portfolio leaning toward higher-priced hotels, the company says demand has improved recently and its FY11 outlook remains positive.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM
  • AMCX

    AMC Networks (AMCX -2.1%) trades lower after Morgan Stanley starts coverage with an Underweight,...

    AMC Networks (AMCX -2.1%) trades lower after Morgan Stanley starts coverage with an Underweight, beliving the company's "premium multiple" fails to reflect the risks presented by "ratings maturation at AMC or increased programming investment across its portfolio."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:29 PM
  • AFL

    Life insurers are higher after Financial Stability Oversight Council gave preliminary approval...

    Life insurers are higher after Financial Stability Oversight Council gave preliminary approval yesterday to criteria that largely clears the non-bank financial companies from being considered systemically important.: Aflac (AFL +5.9%), Ameriprise Financial (AMP +4.4%), Genworth Financial (GNW +5.1%), Hartford Financial (HIG +4.4%) and Lincoln National (LNC +6.6%).

     
     
     
     
    | 3:18 PM | 1 Comment
  • AA

    Alcoa (AA -0.8%) is still off slightly following its Q3 report, but Aluminum Corp. of China (ACH...

    Alcoa (AA -0.8%) is still off slightly following its Q3 report, but Aluminum Corp. of China (ACH +14.2%) is soaring, as investors focus on Alcoa's revenue beat rather than its EPS miss, and perhaps also its bullish CC comments on Chinese demand. Other aluminum makers are posting smaller gains. CENX +2.5%. NOR +1.5%. KALU +1.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:01 PM
  • AYI

    Having soared +24% since bottoming last Tuesday, Acuity (AYI +3.5%) racks up further gains...

    Having soared +24% since bottoming last Tuesday, Acuity (AYI +3.5%) racks up further gains today, despite a tepid initiation by Jefferies with a hold. The firm says its business is heavily tied to U.S. construction activity, which remains weak, and recommends moving to the sidelines to wait for signs of a sustainable U.S. housing and construction recovery.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM
  • INFY

    Infosys (INFY +8%), whose latest quarter and full-year guidance beat expectations, sees no signs...

    Infosys (INFY +8%), whose latest quarter and full-year guidance beat expectations, sees no signs of a slowdown in corporate IT spending, according to the head of its Americas business and of global financial services. Pre-approved projects are sometimes being sent back to CEOs for re-approval, but INFY continues to see strong spending on customer-centric projects.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM
  • RMBS

    Rambus (RMBS +2.5%) adds to its gains after Bloomberg reports the jury deliberating on the...

    Rambus (RMBS +2.5%) adds to its gains after Bloomberg reports the jury deliberating on the company's antitrust suit against Micron (NASDAQ:MU) and Hynix has asked to review trial testimony from Micron VP Michael Sadler.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM
  • CRR

    Carbo Ceramics (CRR +3.3%) gains after Morgan Keegan upgrades the stock to outperform on...

    Carbo Ceramics (CRR +3.3%) gains after Morgan Keegan upgrades the stock to outperform on valuation, citing ceramic proppant growth potential.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM | 1 Comment
  • BWP

    Boardwalk Pipeline Partners (BWP +3.1%) gets a lift after Morgan Keegan ups the shares to...

    Boardwalk Pipeline Partners (BWP +3.1%) gets a lift after Morgan Keegan ups the shares to Outperform on valuation, citing the company's 2-3% distribution growth outlook and an attractive 8% current yield.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM
  • SHLDQ

    Shares of Sears Holdings (SHLD +9.7%) post a strong gain, showing no fear from rival J.C....

    Shares of Sears Holdings (SHLD +9.7%) post a strong gain, showing no fear from rival J.C. Penney's (JCP -1.1%) move to buy the Liz Claiborne and Monet brands. With more reports of slow consumer spending at retail stores piling in, investors may be latching onto Sears' ability to cut the fat over growing Q4 revenue briskly.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:09 PM
  • TZOO

    Travelzoo (TZOO +13.2%) shares soar after Jefferies launches coverage with a Buy rating and $35...

    Travelzoo (TZOO +13.2%) shares soar after Jefferies launches coverage with a Buy rating and $35 price target. The market for online local deals is expanding rapidly, Jefferies says, with U.S. industry revenues projected to hit $2.7B in 2011 from $1.1B. TZOO's gross sales in local deals were $26M in Q2, up from $750K in Q3 2010; net revenue was $9M in Q2, up from $300K in Q3 2010.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:56 PM
  • P

    Pandora (NYSE:P) lines up another strategic automobile industry ally, announcing Cadillac will...

    Pandora (NYSE:P) lines up another strategic automobile industry ally, announcing Cadillac will incorporate the firm's CUE system in upcoming XTS and ATS luxury sedans. Reports on Pandora-killers beating down shares (I, II, III) look to be a bit premature, as shares have gone on a 48% run over the last month and stand up 1.8% on the day.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:51 PM | 1 Comment
  • HUM

    Humana (HUM +4.4%) and HealthSpring (HS +5.3%) both rack up gains after Oppenheimer ups the...

    Humana (HUM +4.4%) and HealthSpring (HS +5.3%) both rack up gains after Oppenheimer ups the Medicare Advantage-focused health insurers to outperform. The firm cites a favorable outlook for the program's growth, especially as the baby boomers continue to favor MA plans over traditional fee-for-services. Additionally, both companies should see a market share boost due to this year's open enrollment, which starts Saturday.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:51 PM
  • FDX

    Deutsche keeps a Buy rating in place for FedEx (FDX +2.5%), but lowers its price target on...

    Deutsche keeps a Buy rating in place for FedEx (FDX +2.5%), but lowers its price target on shares by $6 to $111 - still repping significant 47% upside potential. FDX now trades above where it stood before its recent profit warning, helped in part with a little jawboning from CEO Fred Smith along the way.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:39 PM
  • KATE

    Liz Clairborne (LIZ +36.7%) continues to skyrocket on the sale of four apparel brands. CEO Bill...

    Liz Clairborne (LIZ +36.7%) continues to skyrocket on the sale of four apparel brands. CEO Bill McComb explains the move by stating the company needed to lower its debt load, given the cost of its capital structure. KeyBanc's Edward Yruma believes the deals will allow Liz Clairborne to transform into a "growth retailer."
     
     
     
     
    | 1:34 PM
  • STNR

    Steiner Leisure (STNR +5%) trades up after saying it's acquired the assets of Cortiva Group, a...

    Steiner Leisure (STNR +5%) trades up after saying it's acquired the assets of Cortiva Group, a private operator of post-secondary massage therapy schools, for $33M in cash. The acquisition is expected to be accretive to earnings post-integration and neutral to slightly accretive to earnings in 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:29 PM
  • ZLC

    Zale (ZLC +8.9%) pops after saying it's hired Thomas Haubenstricker as its new CFO. The move...

    Zale (ZLC +8.9%) pops after saying it's hired Thomas Haubenstricker as its new CFO. The move gives the company's current financial chief, Matt Appel, greater opportunity to focus on a broader range of strategic and operational initiatives in his role as chief administrative officer, a post he adopted earlier this year.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:20 PM
  • S

    Sprint (S +5.9%) rallies for a second day after BTIG's Walter Piecyk, who skewered the carrier's...

    Sprint (S +5.9%) rallies for a second day after BTIG's Walter Piecyk, who skewered the carrier's investor day performance, strikes a more conciliatory tone. Piecyk thinks fears about Sprint's ability to raise additional capital are overdone, and believes its existing cash and credit assets are enough to handle any near-term cash burn. (yesterday)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:19 PM

  • Stocks leg up to new highs on the day, with the 12%+ rally from last Tuesday's low taking the...

    Stocks leg up to new highs on the day, with the 12%+ rally from last Tuesday's low taking the DJIA back to positive for the year. For the day, DJIA +1.5%, S&P 500 +1.8%, Nasdaq +1.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:10 PM | 1 Comment
  • PVH

    PVH, formerly known as Phillips-Van Heusen, gains +6% after saying it expects Q3 and FY11 EPS to...

    PVH, formerly known as Phillips-Van Heusen, gains +6% after saying it expects Q3 and FY11 EPS to be at least at the high end of guidance, as the apparel company reaps the benefits from strong sales in its Calvin Klein and newly acquired Tommy Hilfiger brands. The company said back in August it expects Q3 EPS in the range of $ 1.75 to $1.81 on revenue of between $1.61B to $1.63B.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM
  • GMCR

    Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR -4.8%) announces an agreement with Jarden (JAH +3.1%) to...

    Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR -4.8%) announces an agreement with Jarden (JAH +3.1%) to expand the line of Mr. Coffee single-cup coffeemakers featuring Keurig technology - aimed at giving consumers the choice of over 200 varieties of single-serving K-Cup portion packs.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM
  • WDC

    Western Digital (WDC -2.7%) trades lower after saying production of hard drives will be...

    Western Digital (WDC -2.7%) trades lower after saying production of hard drives will be constrained in the current quarter due to severe flooding in Thailand. The disk-drive maker said its Thailand facilities are operational, but it has temporarily suspended production to protect against water damage.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:33 PM
  • FCAU

    The UAW-Chrysler (FIATY.PK) deal includes an initial signing bonus of $1,750 per worker, matched...

    The UAW-Chrysler (FIATY.PK) deal includes an initial signing bonus of $1,750 per worker, matched again if the carmaker meets profit targets. The pay scale for entry-level workers lines up with rates previously negotiated by Ford (F +3.4%) and General Motors (GM +3.8%), while no cap exists for entry-level hires until 2015. Shares of parent Fiat are up 9.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:32 PM
  • NWS

    The battle to shake up News Corp.'s (NWS +2.4%) board continues, as investors receive another...

    The battle to shake up News Corp.'s (NWS +2.4%) board continues, as investors receive another recommendation, this time from advisory firm Egan-Jones, suggesting shareholders vote against four of its directors, including the sons of Rupert Murdoch.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:21 PM
  • PTEN

    Patterson-UTI Energy (PTEN +1.9%) says Q3 revenue will top Wall Street's expectations, as...

    Patterson-UTI Energy (PTEN +1.9%) says Q3 revenue will top Wall Street's expectations, as strength in its drilling and pressure-pumping offset softer performance from oil and natural gas sales. It now expects revenue of $674M, better than analysts expectations of $669M.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:12 PM
  • SCLN

    SciClone Pharmaceuticals (SCLN +2.5%) trades up after a California court grants preliminary...

    SciClone Pharmaceuticals (SCLN +2.5%) trades up after a California court grants preliminary approval for the company to settle a number of derivative lawsuits filed against the company by its shareholders.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:04 PM
  • PWER

    Power-One (PWER +5.1%) blows off a reduction in its Q3 guidance and a ratings downgrade at...

    Power-One (PWER +5.1%) blows off a reduction in its Q3 guidance and a ratings downgrade at Northland Securities to trade higher this morning. The stock had been -8% in pre-market trading after lowering its revenue outlook for Q3 on slowing global demand, but the shares appear to have reached a point of selling exhaustion since hitting a new 52-week low last week.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:45 AM
  • PEP

    Pepsico (PEP +3.3%) CFO Hugh Johnston dismisses the idea of splitting the company in two,...

    Pepsico (PEP +3.3%) CFO Hugh Johnston dismisses the idea of splitting the company in two, saying he doesn't see the value in it. Struggles in Pepsico's drinks business while its Frito-Lay snacks business performs well have increased calls for a breakup patterned after Kraft (KFT) and Sara Lee (SLE). But PEP's Q3 earnings were a pleasant surprise in a weak economy.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM
  • REGN

    Regeneron Pharmaceuticals (REGN -1%) trades lower after Bloomberg reports Roche's Avastin drug,...

    Regeneron Pharmaceuticals (REGN -1%) trades lower after Bloomberg reports Roche's Avastin drug, a rival to Regeneron's Eylea, may continue to be reimbursed by the U.S. government. Regeneron popped last month after the Department of Veteran Affairs dropped Avastin. Blue Shield of California dropped Avastin last week.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:40 AM
  • FSLR

    First Solar (FSLR -0.2%) underperforms after receiving another bearish analyst note (I, II),...

    First Solar (FSLR -0.2%) underperforms after receiving another bearish analyst note (I, II), this one featuring a downgrade to Sell from Ticonderoga, and a $40 PT. Ticonderoga is troubled by a guidance cut and downbeat commentary from Phoenix Solar, and thinks First Solar's module business will begin posting losses in 2012.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM | 1 Comment
  • CLF

    Cliffs Natural Resources (CLF +4.8%) pops after the company says it's resumed operations at one...

    Cliffs Natural Resources (CLF +4.8%) pops after the company says it's resumed operations at one of its coal mines in West Virginia. Activity was halted there more than four months ago due to high detected levels of carbon monoxide. The mine produces metallurgical coal used for making steel.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM
  • WMT

    Wal-Mart's (WMT +2.4%) head of U.S. operations Bill Simon says the unit posted positive...

    Wal-Mart's (WMT +2.4%) head of U.S. operations Bill Simon says the unit posted positive same-store sales in September for the third straight month after nine straight monthly declines. Capital spending on new stores will increase in 2012 to as much as $3.9B from $2.7B, but remodeling costs will be cut to $1.3B-$1.5B from $3B.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM
  • PRSN

    BSD Medical (BSDM +2.5%) trades up after it says study results demonstrate improved survival for...

    BSD Medical (BSDM +2.5%) trades up after it says study results demonstrate improved survival for pancreatic-cancer patients using its heat therapy treatment along with chemotherapy and radiation compared to those patients treated with chemotherapy and radiation therapy alone.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM
  • BCS

    SocGen recommends overweighting the European banking sector, saying the fears surrounding it are...

    SocGen recommends overweighting the European banking sector, saying the fears surrounding it are overdone. The firm notes that current valuations are discounting a worst-case scenario, and leave significant upside potential if fears prove excessive. Some of its top picks include: Barclays (BCS +8%), Lloyds (LYG +2.3%), Royal Bank of Scotland (RBS +3.8%)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM | 2 Comments
  • NSR

    Neustar (NYSE:NSR) extends its gains from AH trading, now up 6.8%, after announcing a deal to...

    Neustar (NYSE:NSR) extends its gains from AH trading, now up 6.8%, after announcing a deal to acquire called ID provider Targus Information for $650M in a move the company forecasts will add $0.20 to its EPS. CEO Lisa Hook writes in a blog post: "We will be able to greatly extend Neustar’s ability to provide its customers services based on unique, non-replicable dataset."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM
  • AONEQ

    Shares of automotive parts companies turn lower after A123 Systems' (AONE +16%) big contract...

    Shares of automotive parts companies turn lower after A123 Systems' (AONE +16%) big contract from GM shines a light on the potential for electric cars. Decliners: AAP -1.6%, ORLY -1.6%, PBY-OLD -3.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM | 1 Comment
  • FLIR

    FLIR Systems (FLIR -1.1%) trades lower after JPMorgan cut the shares to Underweight on...

    FLIR Systems (FLIR -1.1%) trades lower after JPMorgan cut the shares to Underweight on valuation. The firm says Street estimates are too high. The company currently trades at 16.1 times earnings, a level that is difficult to justify with declining DoD budgets and the cyclical risks in the commercial segment.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM
  • ARO

    Aeropostale (NYSE:ARO) gives back some of yesterday's post-upgrade gains after a class action...

    Aeropostale (NYSE:ARO) gives back some of yesterday's post-upgrade gains after a class action lawsuit accuses various officers and directors of violations of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 - namely making false statements regarding the firm's business and prospects. Shares are down 3% today, but are still holding on to a 17% runup over the last 5 trading sessions.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 AM
  • FCX

    Check out the remarkable moves in currencies (aussie +300 pips in 12 hours!) and key commodities...

    Check out the remarkable moves in currencies (aussie +300 pips in 12 hours!) and key commodities starting right about the time China opened for business last night  This rally may have little to do with Europe and everything to do with China showing signs of opening the spigots again. Chinese shares +3%. RE ETF: TAO +5.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 AM
  • JPM

    Financial stocks (XLF +2.1%) are a primary source of leadership in the early going, as...

    Financial stocks (XLF +2.1%) are a primary source of leadership in the early going, as diversified players such as JPMorgan Chase (JPM +1%) and Citigroup (C +4.9%) rally on the back of aggressive buying. U.S. banks follow the lead of European counterparts: Deutsche Bank (NYSE:DB) +6.6%, Barclays (NYSE:BCS) +8.7%, SocGen (OTCPK:SCGLY) +6.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:19 AM
  • AAL

    Airline stocks move higher led by sold gains from US Airways (LCC +8.7%) and Delta (DAL +3.2%)....

    Airline stocks move higher led by sold gains from US Airways (LCC +8.7%) and Delta (DAL +3.2%). Yesterday, shares of the two carriers turned lower AH after announcing they were swapping landing and takeoff slots at LaGuardia and Reagan National Airport before turning around today. Dahlman Rose analyst Helane Becker approves of the transaction, saying it helps DAL control the N.Y. market and it "has been a long time coming." NYSE Arca Airline Index +2.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:18 AM
  • OUTR

    Shares of Coinstar (NASDAQ:CSTR), up 3.3%, get a boost from Piper Jaffray after analysts keep an...

    Shares of Coinstar (NASDAQ:CSTR), up 3.3%, get a boost from Piper Jaffray after analysts keep an Overweight rating in place to go along with a healthy $68 price target. The firm points to data showing a nice lift to Redbox's DVD kiosk business and Web traffic after the Netflix (NFLX +3.9%) pricing debacle turned away a portion of their own customers.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:02 AM | 1 Comment

  • "The S&P 500 has broken 1,200 (this tweet also works for December 21, 1998)," quips Eddy...

    "The S&P 500 has broken 1,200 (this tweet also works for December 21, 1998)," quips Eddy Elfenbein.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:00 AM | 3 Comments
  • ARUN

    Investors may want to rethink their connection to Aruba Networks (ARUN -1.2%), Heard On The...

    Investors may want to rethink their connection to Aruba Networks (ARUN -1.2%), Heard On The Street says. Emerging WiFi start-ups let companies manage their WiFi networks over the Internet instead of with expensive controllers that make up 40% of Aruba's revenue. Shares are well off earlier highs and may have further to fall.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM
  • LXK

    Lexmark (NYSE:LXK) gets clipped with a downgrade from JPMorgan to Neutral on concerns over...

    Lexmark (NYSE:LXK) gets clipped with a downgrade from JPMorgan to Neutral on concerns over margin pressure. Analysts with the firm set a $25 price target, repping 8% downside potential. Shares opened sharply lower before catching their breath and now stand down 1.1% for the day.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM
  • PCXCQ

    Patriot Coal (PCX) -3.9% premarket after Goldman Sachs cuts its rating to Sell and reduces its...

    Patriot Coal (PCX) -3.9% premarket after Goldman Sachs cuts its rating to Sell and reduces its price target on the shares to $10, citing a less attractive upside for PCX and limited catalysts in the absence of rising prices. Goldman says Consol Energy (NYSE:CNX) and Peabody Energy (NYSE:BTU) are the most oversold in the group of coal firms it covers.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM
  • COO

    The Cooper Companies (NYSE:COO) is up 3.9% premarket after announcing it's continuing to work...

    The Cooper Companies (NYSE:COO) is up 3.9% premarket after announcing it's continuing to work with the FDA to complete a recall for some of its Avaira Toric contact lenses. Cooper fell 8.2% yesterday on high volume; today's rebound suggests the decline may have been sparked by fears of a stronger regulatory response from the FDA.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:27 AM
  • BRCD

    Brocade (NASDAQ:BRCD) -2.9% premarket after JPMorgan downgrades shares to Underweight on...

    Brocade (NASDAQ:BRCD) -2.9% premarket after JPMorgan downgrades shares to Underweight on expectations IT budgets will remain under pressure and earnings estimates will need to be reduced.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:27 AM
  • FE

    EU President Barroso is set to unveil bank recapitalization plans before Parliament. Watch live...

    EU President Barroso is set to unveil bank recapitalization plans before Parliament. Watch live here. European shares are skying to new highs for the session as he is about to begin. Stoxx 50 +2.3%. The euro is flying as well, +1.1% to $1.3784 after flirting with $1.30 just one week ago.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:09 AM | 1 Comment
  • KATE

    Premarket gainers: LIZ +42%. AONE +15%. FRO +10%. ONXX +8%. TEL +7%. ALU +7%. BCS +6%. ING +5%....

    Premarket gainers: LIZ +42%. AONE +15%. FRO +10%. ONXX +8%. TEL +7%. ALU +7%. BCS +6%. ING +5%. ASML +5%. DB +5%. MT +5%. RBS +5%. MPEL +5%. GNW +5%. CS +4%. DRYS +4%. YRCW +3%. SIRI +3%. S +3%. BHP +3%. NOK +3%. FCX +3%. UBS +3%. QGEN +3%. AU +3%. MCP +3%. RIO +3%.
    Losers: CHKM -5%. PCX -5%. PWER -4%. AT -4%. AA -4%. HST -3%. FSLR -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:05 AM
  • ONXX

    Onyx Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ONXX) agrees to settle and dismiss all claims related to the...

    Onyx Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ONXX) agrees to settle and dismiss all claims related to the complaint filed by Onyx against Bayer (OTCPK:BAYRY), restructuring their partnership for developing and marketing of Nexavar tablets and entering into a new agreement related to the late-stage oncology compound regorafenib. ONXX +6.9% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:53 AM
  • AONEQ

    A123 Systems (AONE) is up 16% premarket after CNBC reports the company will supply batteries for...

    A123 Systems (AONE) is up 16% premarket after CNBC reports the company will supply batteries for GM's latest Chevy Spark model.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:47 AM
  • KATE

    Liz Clairborne (LIZ) jumps 22.4% premarket after announcing it's selling 4 clothing brands for...

    Liz Clairborne (LIZ) jumps 22.4% premarket after announcing it's selling 4 clothing brands for proceeds of $328M. The company's Liz Clairborne and Monet brands will be sold to J.C. Penney (NYSE:JCP), and its Dana Buchman brand will be sold to Kohl's (NYSE:KSS). Liz Clairborne expects the moves to lower its earnings, but to also bring down its net debt to the $270M-$290M range.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:36 AM
  • GTATQ

    GT Advanced Technologies (GTAT) drops 6% premarket after Jefferies starts the maker of solar and...

    GT Advanced Technologies (GTAT) drops 6% premarket after Jefferies starts the maker of solar and LED manufacturing equipment at Underperform. Jefferies' $5 PT values GT at just 4x its estimated calendar 2013 EPS, a low valuation the firm considers justified by solar and LED oversupply, order cancellation risk, and margin pressure.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:20 AM
  • ACMP

    Shares of Chesapeake Midstream Partners (CHKM) move down 5.1% premarket after the company...

    Shares of Chesapeake Midstream Partners (CHKM) move down 5.1% premarket after the company announces a secondary public offering of 10M shares representing limited partner interests held by Global Infrastructure Partners.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:17 AM
  • JCI

    Johnson Controls (NYSE:JCI) forecasts sales of $44B (+9% Y/Y) on higher auto production in North...

    Johnson Controls (NYSE:JCI) forecasts sales of $44B (+9% Y/Y) on higher auto production in North America and China offsetting flat European production. The company also sees increasing capital investments in 2012 to $1.7B to "support organic growth opportunities." Shares -1.8% premarket.
